title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — On a night where the final score was a mere footnote, Michael Jordan authored a final, breathtaking chapter in his Chicago Bulls legend.

Facing the Charlotte Hornets in what would become his iconic last act at the Chicago Stadium, Jordan delivered a performance for the ages, pouring in a game-high 40 points to power the Bulls to a dominant 110-79 victory. It was less a game and more a masterclass, a coronation of the game’s greatest player on the stage he built.

From the opening tip, Jordan was relentless. He carved through the Charlotte defense with a mesmerizing array of fadeaways, drives, and mid-range jumpers that left defenders grasping at air. Each basket was met with a rising crescendo of adoration from the home crowd, who sensed they were witnessing something transcendent. While Scottie Pippen provided crucial all-around support with 16 points and Dennis Rodman cleaned the glass with 13 rebounds, the night belonged to one man alone.

Jordan’s 40-point outburst was more than just a statistical marvel; it was a historical exclamation point. In his final appearance in the hallowed arena, he poured in one last, monumental scoring total, a fitting farewell to the city that watched him become a global icon. The lopsided score only emphasized his singular dominance.

As the final seconds bled from the clock, the result was secured, but the memory was cemented. Michael Jordan didn't just win a game; he provided an indelible, passionate farewell, leaving every fan in attendance with a story to tell for a lifetime: the night His Airness scored 40 one last time.
